alert.note: Alert for Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:13PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster County through 300 PM EDT... At 212 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Woodland Valley Campground, or 18 miles southwest of Hunter, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodstock, Woodland Valley Campground, West Hurley, West Shokan, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Mount Tremper, Phoenicia, Denning, Ashokan, Glenford, Oliverea, Shultis Corners, Sweet Meadows, Brodhead, Sawkill, Woodland, Zena, Montoma, Morgan Hill and Branch. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York.
